title: How to Destroy a CD or DVD

steps.headline: Fold and bust.
steps.description: Wrap the discs with plastic wrap and then fold it until it breaks.

steps.headline: Shred the discs with a disc shredder.
Cut the discs.
steps.description: You can use a pair of scissors, but be careful as the foil will flake.

steps.headline: Break the discs.
steps.description: Wrap the discs with a towel and use a kick or a hammer to destroy the disc. The towel is used to protect you.

steps.headline: Cut the discs with a knife.
Center punch the discs.
steps.description: Punch at least 12 holes on the discs.

steps.headline: Microwave the discs.
steps.description: Place the disc into a microwave and set it for 5-10 seconds, or until you see sparks. The microwave cannot be used for food after that. Always use adult supervision when doing this step.

steps.headline: Use a blow torch to melt the discs.
steps.description: Do in a safe area using proper safety gear. The ground on which the CDs sit should be inflammable, such as concrete.

steps.headline: Cover the disc with duct tape, then rip it off.
steps.description: This does not work on all discs.

steps.headline: Sand the discs.
steps.description: Use a belt sander on the top side of the disc. This should be done in an easy-to-clean area.

steps.headline: Wipe with acetone.
steps.description: Soak a cotton pad in pure acetone, then wipe the bottom of the disc with it. It should become frosted and unreadable.
